description: The story follows Kaizaki Arata, a 27-year-old jobless man, who fails at every job interview he had after quitting his last company. His life changes after he met Yoake Ryou of the ReLife Research Institute, who offered him a drug that can change his appearance to 17-years-old and to become a subject in an experiment for one year. Thus, he begins his life as a high school student once more.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Volleyball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of volleyball.

node.description:
__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tommy_army) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tommytomokokawase/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E7%80%AC%E6%99%BA%E5%AD%90)

Tomoko Kawase is a Japanese singer, songwriter, producer, actress, and model. She is the lead singer of the alternative rock band The Brilliant Green. She also has a solo career under the pseudonym Tommy Heavenly6 and Tommy February6.

Her debut solo album Tommy february6 peaked at No. 1 on the Japan Oricon chart. The album was certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of Japan, as well as her second studio album Tommy Airline. She has released eight solo albums. Her songs appeared in various anime including Paradise Kiss, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Soul Eater, Pokémon, Gin Tama, and Bakuman. Two of her songs were used in the 2004 film adaption of Kamikaze Girls. From 2001 to 2009, she released music through Defstar Records, a division of Sony Music Japan. In 2010 she was signed to Warner Music Japan.

(Source: Wikipedia)
**Shunsaku Okuda** is part of The Brilliant Green and married to [Tomoko Kawase](https://anilist.co/staff/101485/).

[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/thebrilliantgreenTV) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Brilliant_Green) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_brilliant_green)

The Brilliant Green is a Japanese pop rock band formed in 1997 who were signed to Sony Music Entertainment Japan. On December 1, 2009, The Brilliant Green announced that they had signed with Warner Music Group Japan.

Members:
- [Tomoko Kawase](https://anilist.co/staff/101485/) (1995-)
- [Shunsaku Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/184275/) (1995-)

Past Members:
- Ryo Matsui (1995-2010)

[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/thebrilliantgreenTV) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Brilliant_Green) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_brilliant_green)

The Brilliant Green is a Japanese pop rock band formed in 1997 who were signed to Sony Music Entertainment Japan. On December 1, 2009, The Brilliant Green announced that they had signed with Warner Music Group Japan.

Members:
- [Tomoko Kawase](https://anilist.co/staff/101485/) (1995-)
- [Shunsaku Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/184275/) (1995-)

Past Members:
- Ryo Matsui (1995-2010)
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/studio_pablo)

Founder and representative director of Studio Pablo.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
